intro: Tongoloa zhongdianensis, commonly known as the Zhongdian Tongoloa, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, umbellate inflorescences. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers are typically white or pale yellow. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
